""  A COMMITTEE TO REDUCE SPENDING?  Mike Pence   Jeff Duncan ( R-S.C.) plans to introduce legislation to create a "committee on nonessential federal expenditures,""  according to an alert passed along by a source.  The committee would be based on the` Byrd Committee' proposed by Senator Harry Byrd( D-VA) in the 77th Congress. That committee is credited with saving taxpayers$ 38 billion( in inflation adjusted dollars) during its existence. The committee would be unique in that its sole purpose would be to reduce federal spending. Mike McDaniel  said that while he was state GOP chairman- from 1995 until 2002-  Mike Pence  mentioned the  Eric Holcomb 's office to him.  He told me then that he thought he could accomplish more for the people of Indiana as  Eric Holcomb  than he could in Congress,  he said. "This has been on his mind for a long time.""

Ben Young  of Richmond thinks  Mike Pence  made the right decision. "My hope is that he runs for governor. I think it's rather fortuitous that it's open at this particular time,""   Ben Young  said.  I think it's obvious that he wants to serve in perhaps a higher capacity.   Ben Young , who has met with  Mike Pence  locally and in his Washington, D.C., office, said  Mike Pence  would do well if elected governor, but Indiana would miss his presence in Congress.
